journal-meta.journal-title: Proceedings of the Institution of Mechanical Engineers, Part C: Journal of Mechanical Engineering Science

p.bold: Theoretical design and experimental verification of a 1/50 scale model of a quayside container crane

body.p: Y L Jin and Z G Li

The authors would like to bring attention to the errors published in ‘Theoretical design and experimental verification of a 1/50 scale model of a quayside container crane’ Y L Jin and Z G Li Proceedings of the IMechE Part C: J. Mechanical Engineering Science, 2012, Vol. 226 (6), pp. 1644–1662, DOI 10.1177/0954406211423603

The original sentence: In this study, the scale factors of geometry (length), Young’s modulus and density, as the known scale factors, are λ = 50, λE = 1 and λρ = 1, respectively. Should read: In this study, the scale factors of geometry (length), inputting acceleration, Young’s modulus and density, as the known scale factors, are λ = 50, λai = 1/50, λE = 1 and λρ = 1, respectively.

The original sentence: mainly including the scale factors of time λt, frequency λω, mass λM, deformation (displacement) λu, velocity λv, acceleration λa, strain λε, stress λσ and viscous damping λd. Should read: mainly including the scale factors of time λt, frequency λω, mass λM, displacement (deformation) λu, response velocity λv, response acceleration λa, strain λε, stress λσ and viscous damping λd.

p.bold: Sections 2.2.3 and 2.2.4 should read as follows

p.italic: 2.2.3 Scale factors of deformation λu, response velocity λv and response acceleration λa

body.p: According to the relationship of the displacement, the velocity and the acceleration, it is known that scale factor of the displacement (deformation) is the basis for determining the scale factors of the velocity and acceleration. Under the action of exoteric acceleration excitations, the external force F and lateral shear force Fs of Euler beam can be written as equation (7) and equation (8), respectively: (7) (8) where M is the mass of the bending beam, and ai is the inputting acceleration. Through the equilibrium equation F = Fs and the foregoing equation (6), one can get (9)
Substituting equation (3) into equation (9), λu is expressed by (10)

Because the velocity is equal to the first differential of the displacement to time and the acceleration is equal to the second differential of the displacement to time, the scale factors of response velocity λv and response acceleration λa can be expressed as follows: (11) (12)

p.italic: 2.2.4 Scale factors of strain λε and stress λσ

body.p: In the mechanics of materials, the computational formula of strain is given by (13) where ε is the strain, R is the radius of curvature of neutral layer, y is the distance apart from neutral layer, dθ is the angle of rotation, Me is the moment, L is the arm of force, as shown in Fig. 3. According to the dimensional analysis theory, the scale factor of strain λε is deduced as follows (14) where λy is the scale factor of the distance apart from the neutral layer (λy = 50). Substituting equations (3), (6) and (12) into equation (14) gives birth to (15)

According to the Hooke’s law, the relationship between the strain and the stress in the elastic phase can be written as (16) where σ is the stress of structure. Through the dimensional analysis theory, we can obtain (17) where λσ is the scale factor of the stress.

p.bold: on page 1649 should appear as follows

caption.p: Scale factors of quayside container crane

tr.td: Scale factor of Young’s modulus λE
Scale factor of cross-sectional radius of inertia λr
Scale factor of response velocity λv
Scale factor of response acceleration λa
Scale factor of viscous damping λd
